nodes.bodyText: If a JDK7 user has paid for profiling we really should warn them as opposed to inform them...
The issue with putting this at warn is that this runs regardless if profiling is enabled or disabled
I'd move it to debug then, my point about "having paid for profiling" probably doesn't apply.
or wrap it with a check to see if profiling is actually enabled
We shouldn't log the state of the user's configuration at INFO level
Profiling is an opt in feature, you need to enable it. I'd hope if I enabled and arranged API keys that it that it would start.
Also the check isInfoEnabled() should be changed to isDebugEnabled() or completely omitted.
Better not to log things derived from configuration information at INFO level
Seems pretty serious to me.
Yeah, this might be questionable - while I agree that this could be serious I remember having some customers spooked by logged WARN and ERROR messages :/ So, it's a tough call on this one :(
I prefer it this way - the API key has been configured, but it's not going to work, profiles don't show up, rather than have a weird support issue they get a WARNing.
That said, I don't have to support the profiler, so I'll change it back if you want.
The user has enabled it, they've got the API key right, they probably hope it just works.
I'd certainly hope so
This is too much of an implementation detail to log at info
TRACE_ALL_EXECUTORS isn't enabled by default and not expected to be left on, so I have a mild preference to this being kept at info.
we log this elsewhere
This will have been explicitly configured, let's keep it at debug level for those curious whether their config settings are honoured or not
It should definitely exit
I wonder if this should be warn or debug, but don't think it should be info
Under what scenario would this ever throw?  Isn't UTF-8 always available?
You tell me! I didn't write the log message!
haha... no idea.
